page.title: 18HOUSING IN GAINFORD
page.content: { In Gainford there is a variety of styles of housing. Around the{village {green}the housing is terraced. Along High Row, rich{Georgian merchants built their houses and settled down in Gainford coming from Darlington. There is some{Victorian}housing scattered around the village, near the old railway line. South View was built in the 19th century as boarding houses. Eden Crest, Station Court and Orchard Grove are all{council housing.}Balmer Hill, Station Court and Academy Gardens are more recent modern developments, built during the last twenty years. In Gainford today there are no new developments being built, except for Snow Hall and an old farmhouse being renovated and re-furbished and being sold as new houses.
